intro: Zygogynum queenslandianum subsp. australe, commonly known as the Australian zygogynum, is a species of flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and leathery, dark green leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open forests or heathlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
